sub_title: Managing Director at Kantor Pos-Music Theatre and Stage Management-MTSM BV
summary:
Press:

"Mosterd’s work is renowned for exploring European and Asian bodies as well as movement, searching for contrasts and similarities"​ - Jakarta Post (Indonesia)

"Master choreography from the Netherlands"​ - Koran Tempo (Indonesia)

"Emotions coming from rice and potatoes were truly tangible"​ - Kompas (Indonesia)

"Hilarious, moving and cheerful theater"​ – Tempo Magazine (Indonesia)

"He has understood Asian dance to be more about meaning and philosophy instead of technique"​ -
       Sinar Harapan (Indonesia)

"Daring duet"​ - Java Post/Surabaya Post (Indonesia)

"Audacious and dark dialogue"​ - Tempo (Indonesia)

"Dazzling. Ketuk Tilu was a mindblowingly sexy piece. Very satisfying piece of work, and audiences reacted strongly"​ - Daily Seni (Malaysia)

"Woke visceral emotions. Intoxicating. Exciting. - The New Straits Times (Malaysia)

"The best of two worlds"​ - Haagsche Courant (Netherlands)

"Bulls Eye for performers and audience"​ - De Groene Amsterdammer (Netherlands)

"Fusion of two cultures. Convincing performance"​ - De Telegraaf (Netherlands)

"Intriguing dance piece"​ - Leeuwarder Courant (Netherlands)

"Ingenious, imaginative choreography by director Gerard Mosterd" - NRC Handelsblad (Netherlands)

"L'Histoire du Soldat is a remarkable experience. Top Production" - Cultuurpodium (Netherlands)

"Integer and intimate dance performance"​ - De Stentor (Netherlands)

"Kamu/Jij by Gerard Mosterd is accurate and full of subtleties"​ - Utrechts Nieuwsblad (Netherlands)

"Seldom has a question been translated so clear in image and movement"​ - Rotterdams Dagblad (Netherlands)

"A new, Indonesian version of the famous Soldier's Tale by Stravinsky"​ - Telegraaf (Netherlands)

"Dancing on Indonesia's double morality"​ - Trouw (Netherlands)

"Glorious dance performance"​ - Eindhovens Dagblad (Netherlands)

"Tribute to the non - western culture" - Dagblad van het Noorden (Netherlands)

"The director (choreographer and director) Gerard Mosterd did not try to come up with some kind of his own story, but followed the author’s plan, the music, creating a hymn to the ever-changing Fortune. Modern choreography, incredible plasticity fascinates the viewer. The director managed to get practically jewelry out of the performance from the soloists and the corps de ballet." Viknaodessa (Ukraine)

"Undoubtedly, "Carmina Burana" will be one of the best performances of the theater's repertoire." - Culturemeter.od.ua (Ukraine)

treasury_media.title: Carmina Burana 2020 National Opera & Ballet of Ukraine, Odessa
treasury_media.description:
Music: Carl Orff.
National Opera & Ballet of Ukraine, Odessa. (150 people)

Conductor: Igor Chernetski.
Choir Director: Valerii Regrut
Child Choir: Pearls of Odessa - Larissa Garbuz.

Concept, direction, choreography, dramaturgy, scenography: Gerard Mosterd
Assistant to the choreographer, repetiteur, additional co-choreography: Julia Mitomi.
Video: Sibe Kokke.
Costume: Nancy Avondts.
Light: Vasko Lisic.
Set: Steven Demedts.

treasury_media.title: Ketuk Tilu (Kuala Lumpur International Arts Festival version) 2015
treasury_media.description: Duet from Ketuk Tilu, choreography by Gerard Mosterd. Music by Jugala Orchestra Bandung. Gugum Gumbirah. Voice by the late Euis Komariah. Danced by January Low and Raziman Sarbini. Auditorium Dewan Bandara Kuala Lumpur. DiverseCity, Kuala Lumpur International Arts Festival, Tepak Tari 2015. Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

treasury_media.title: A Javanese L'Histoire du Soldat 2017 New European Ensemble
treasury_media.description:
Thursday, March 16 to Saturday, April 28, 2017
A collaboration of New European Ensemble with Kantor Pos-Music Theater Stage Management and Teater Salihara Jakarta.

Music Igor Stravinsky
Original story Ferdinand Ramuz
Text Goenawan Mohamad
Director / choreographer Gerard Mosterd
Text editing Bo Tarenskeen
Introductions Frans Leijdelmeijer

Narrator / play Wieteke van Dort
Dancers and actors Rury Avianti, Siko Setyanto, Hendro Yuliyanto
Musicians New European Ensemble

Carmina Burana
Cantata

Music: Carl Orff.
Orchestra, choir, ballet and solo singers of the National Opera & Ballet of Ukraine, Odessa. (150 people)

Premiere: 28th and 29th of February 2020, 18:30 at the National Theatre of Odessa, Ukraine.

treasury_media.title: Stravinsky rekent af met de Nederlandse koloniale politiek
treasury_media.description: De Javaanse versie van Stravinsky’s Soldat is een eindafrekening met de koloniale cultuurpolitiek. Over ‘hoge’ cultuur die zogenaamd gecompromitteerd wordt door ‘het lagere’.

projects.title: Improvisation at EKI Dance studios, Jakarta 2009
projects.description: Moment from an improvisation session for Benny Krisnawardi and dancers.Searching for fresh 'feminine", fluid and circular movement, inspired by the matrilineal Minangkabau from West Sumatra. To be blended with Minang Silat and video projections for the production "Ibu Bhumi" (2009).

company.name: Kantor Pos-Music Theatre and Stage Management

profile_positions.company: Kantor Pos-Music Theatre and Stage Management
profile_positions.description: Booking, organizing and touring international tours with dance, music, opera and ballet productions from Asia and Eastern Europe. Such as April/December 2016/2017/2018/2019: touring Kiev Ballet and Kiev Choir/Credo Kiev Choir in the Netherlands, Luxembourg and Belgium. September/December 2017/2018: Turandot and Carmen opera and Swan Lake/Sleeping Beauty/Nutcracker by Ukrainian National Opera and Ballet Odessa on tour in the Netherlands and Belgium. March 2018: Pique Dame, Giselle, Swan Lake by Ukrainian National Opera and Ballet Odessa on tour in the Netherlands and Belgium. January-February 2019: Bejart Ballet Lausanne, Les Miserables on tour. April-May 2019: La Bayadere, Madame Butterfly by Ukrainian National Opera and Ballet Odessa and Sleeping Beauty by Sint Petersburg Ballet on tour in the Netherlands and Belgium. See: www.kantorpos.nl - www.mtsm.nl
profile_positions.title: Executive Director

profile_positions.description: Selecting and setting up performances, concerts, screenings, exhibitions and intellectual debates around contemporary perspectives concerning SE Asia and the Netherlands/Europe. Bi-annual event at De Melkweg Amsterdam.Bringing and booking Bulantrisna Djelantik,  Novy Delimarta,  Cicilia Jeno, Sekar Sari, Emily Tanaka, Shusaku Takeuchi, Kenzo Kusuda, Raka Maitra, Don't Hit Mama, New Dance Studios, Nippy Noya, Joke Zijlstra, Sapa Lawan, Edward Brantsen, Renadi Santoso and Philemon Mukarno to perform at the Rabozaal and Theaterzaal. Screening Orlow Seunke, Joshua Oppenheimer, Ahmad Fahmi Lubis and Eddy Cahyono movies. Organizing debates with Joshua Oppenheimer. Leonard Retel Helmrich, Fridus Steijlen, Saskia Wieringa, Nursyahbani Katjasungkana, Ward Berenschot. Setting up workshops and lectures such as with Hans Boland and Iwan Marckmann, son of human rights activist Poncke Princen.
profile_positions.title: Head of Programming

profile_positions.description: Writing articles on Asian performing arts for online magazine.
profile_positions.title: Journalist

profile_positions.description: Facilitating performing arts exchange between Asia and Europe. Tour management, production management, international sales, publicity. Booking Stars of the Russian Ballet Gala in Manila's Aliw Theater in collaboration with Ballet Manila. Principal Stars from Mariinsky, Bolshoi and Kiev Ballet - 2010. Initiation of exchange tour between Ballet Manila and Singapore Dance Theatre - 2011. Co-producing a Javanese tour of a Javanese version of Stravinsky's L'Histoire du Soldat and Loevendie's Nightingale with Eko Supriyanto, Martinus Miroto, Sri Qadariatin, Jamaludin Latif, Slamet Gundono and Dutch Chamber Music Company.- 2011. Touring Miroto, Sri Qadariatin, Aerli Rasinah, Budi Hartomo and Sutra Dance Theatre in Europe -2011. Bringing Wangnin Bunmei to Europe -2011. Co-producing a Javanese L'Histoire du Soldat with Eko Supriyanto, Martinus Miroto, Sri Qadariatin, Jamaludin Latif and the Jakarta Symphony with Teater Garasi for the opening of the Indonesian Dance Festival -2012. Bringing Maharani Ayuk Listya to Mundial Festival -2012.Co-producing a Javanese version of Stravinsky's L'Histoire du Soldat with Insomnio Ensemble featuring Rudy Wowor, Rury Avianti, Martinus Miroto and Hendro Yulianto with text by Goenawan Mohamad -2012. -2017 Co-producing a Dutch tour of a Javanese version of Stravinsky's L'Histoire du Soldat with New European Ensemble featuring Wieteke van Dort, Rury Avianti, Siko Setyanto and Hendro Yulianto with text by Goenawan Mohamad.
profile_positions.title: Executive Director

profile_positions.description: Occasionally contributing articles on Dutch-Indonesian performing arts related issues. Dutch-Indonesian printed magazine.
profile_positions.title: Journalist

company.name: Europe On Screen Film Festival, Jakarta

profile_positions.company: Europe On Screen Film Festival, Jakarta
profile_positions.title: Programming assistant

profile_positions.description: Assisting film director Leonard Retel Helmrich for public demonstrations. Combining Single Shot Cinema camera work with an Omni Rig and Airwheel motion.
profile_positions.title: Camera Operator, Camera Assistant

profile_positions.description: Programming recent Asian movies, in particular from Indonesia. Annual Asian film festival in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Programmer

profile_positions.description: Performing the antagonist in "Tjokroaminoto, Guru Bangsa", a new cinema movie by director Garin Nugroho, produced by Christine Hakim. Released in Jakarta, April 2015.
profile_positions.title: Actor, dancer/Cecilius van Dijck
